I know most of the reviews of this game are basically just ironically liking it because of it's wackiness, and that is definitely a highlight of the game, but in all seriousness the gameplay is pretty solid. If you're talking about digitized fighters, you take something like Way of The Warrior (3DO) or even Veteran Combat (Steam) which have very floating and/or clunky controls, whereas this game plays like a pretty decent fighting game.

As far as the silly presentation goes though, I find the poor quality sprites pretty funny. I like the fact that they were obviously filmed using an older camcorder.

Even though the stages are pretty static from what I've seen, it is still enough to make you feel like you're a couple of brief-clad Japanese dudes fighting in the street.

Fun game, I'd pay for DLC.

38898795.review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
Brief Karate Fighter is an absurd, nostalgic-like 2D fighting game involving Japanese men in briefs battling against each other in a competition. While it may look like a low budget arcade game, it's actually somewhat deep into fighting mechanics of both the past and present (and maybe the future! Jk idk lol)

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
When you first start the game, you'll be shown to the menu of course. However, you realise that there isn't any type of tutorial for the game! You also realise that you don't know what the controls are for the game! It's like old times where you had to read the manual to understand the controls. For starters, this may be confusing and/or frustrating as games nowadays include tutorials of some sort. Also you can't bind controls to what keys you wish for, which can also be a pain. The second player controls are even worse (imo), as the binds are in awkward positions. Fortunately, the game can be played with controllers (Xbox's so far, not too sure; dont own a controller) which is presumably (imo) the best experience to play with. 

There are 9 characters, each with their own control schemes for their unique attacks. They're pretty balanced (imo), but there are occasions later on in arcade mode where the A.I will just literally kick your a$$. Not to say that's a bad or a necessary thing to add, however there isn't a difficulty setting nor a training mode, which can turn some people off. The game is in English. But before every fight, there's this weird message thing in Spanish(?). Also the narrator(?) and the fighters all speak Japanese. Furthermore, there's no subtitle option in the game, which can leave newcomers with an "eh?" Overall, controls are effy on keyboard (especially for player 2), a minor language barrier despite being in English, and the characters are decent.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]
Imagine if you had the older Mortal Kombat games and Hong Kong 97 had a child together. This is what it would like. Anyways, the visuals of the game are very reminiscent of the older Mortal Kombat games but at the same time, this looks like it was developed in a low budget (not to say low budget games are terrible tbh). The graphics look arcadey and nostalgic to those who play old arcade fighters. The background stages are just pictures just slapped behind the HUD and characters. It doesn't bother that much but to others, it may or not may be expected for a game that was created from a low budget. Overall, the visuals can be a mixed bag depending on how you look at it.

[h1]Soundtrack+SFX[/h1]
The music and SFX is very reminiscent of music from arcade fighting games and some consoles (such as SNES, Genesis/Mega Drive, 32X etc; imo). The hits you do are somewhat satisfying to hear. Other than that, there's much really much to say other than the music is nostalgic to those who play arcade music. 

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Brief Karate Foolish is a stupidly, WTF arcade-styled fighting game that surprsingly does a good presentation of fighting game mechanics in general, however the lack of tutorial can turn people off as well as the graphics.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+Hilarious characters
+Good gameplay mechanics
+Nice visuals (to some)
+Nice music

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-No tutorial
-Controls are somewhat eh.. for keyboards. (Keyboard controls really suck if you're player 2) 
-Can't rebind controls to different keys.
-Visuals are eh... (to some)
-No difficulty setting (which isn't too much of a bother for me)
-Can't continue after game over in arcade mode (which might piss people off)

[h1]Rating[/h1]
5.99/10

38071396.review:
作为一款美少女格斗游戏，我认为该游戏是纯粹的！
      博诶-奈克斯多 曾经说过：一款纯粹的游戏，一款欢乐的游戏。我认为该作完美的符合了以上三个特征呢。为什么这么说呢？
       这个一款纯粹的游戏。该作的设定是一款简单的格斗游戏，没有拳皇一样花哨的招式，有的只是美少女朴实的转身和拳脚，。甚至就连连招都是那么的朴实，粗糙的线条乍一看令人感叹该作制作者的随意，但是潜心去想，这难道不是格斗游戏的本质吗？试问其中的招式，在座的各位难道不能还原出来吗？所以说，该作是一个纯粹朴实的游戏。甚至简陋的界面，省去了一切花哨的东西，只做格斗，上来就是一堆美少女罗列面前，甚至按键都是与众不同的，也凸显出了该作不同流合污的精神。
      这是一个欢乐的游戏。作为格斗游戏来说，这款游戏的打击感可以说是非常不错了，在游戏中配音能够给予玩家实时的反馈，可谓是良心大作。一声声美少女的嗓音又和曾不刺激着宅男的心。在玩格斗类游戏的同时能带给玩家欢乐，我认识这是一款欢乐的游戏。

It would be FOOLISH not to download this masterpiece of a game! 

The director of Martal Kombat and the actor behind the character of Chackie Jan joined forces to create their magnum opus "Brief Karate Foolish". 
According to Jan's autobiography with the title "Why Do I Look Like a Chinese" the creation of this game has been a childhood dream. After I finished the immersive story mode of this art piece of a video game I can take the liberty to say that the massive amount of passion that was put into creating this game gives a clear vision of that dream.

As for the competetive game mode: There is a massive eSports following despite the game not supporting online gameplay. There are annual meetups in basically any major city south of Cape Town where the best Brief Karate Foolish players known as "Karate Fools" compete against each other to determine who is the greatest Fool!

So go ahead and treat yourself by playing this game!

人物方面，我超爱的。里面全是二次元大屌萌妹，眼睛一个比一个大，还有猫耳娘，黑丝jk什么的，全都一丝不挂只剩一条胖次的那种，超暴露的，我一下子就沉迷其中不能自拔。

♂deep♂

36536051.review:
Скажу прямо, что после Dong Dong Never Die, подобного рода файтинги меня нисколько не удивляют. Сравнивать эту игру с файтингами типа MK, Injustice, King Of Fighters, Street Fighter и т.д. КРАЙНЕ глупо, ибо здесь своя атмосфера. Однако, эта игра как-то роднится с вышеупомянутым DDND (об этом ниже). В DDND - ростер с некоторым закосом под Street Fighter (там даже Марио есть, без шуток), а здесь... ростер бойцов... ну... полуголых мужиков... со своим набором приёмов. Да, здесь бойцов меньше, но тем не менее есть несколько сходств:
1) Дизайн бойцов. В обоих играх использован своеобразный Motion Capture.
2) Упоротость. Чисто азиатская упоротость, даже несмотря на то, что они из разных стран (хотя здесь она намного завышена). 
3) В эти игры будет особо весело играть только будучи немного/неслабо так подшофе. Благо ещё есть возможность с корешами зарезаться (само собой, если они такие же устойчивые к упоротым файтингам).
4) Обе игры бесплатные. Хотя будет очень здорово, если можно кинуть немного шекелей на пиво.
Однако, я заметил значительный минус - здесь нет контюней. Поэтому, если кому-то проиграл - начинай заново. Да и сложность нельзя настроить (или можно, может, я не заметил). Ах да, упраление не совсем понятное на гейпаде, но привыкнуть к нему можно, причём минут за 10 игры. 

Мне больше нечего здесь больше написать, поэтому вердикт:
8 Некомими из 10

36386885.review: Upon first sight, I thought this game would be just another lackluster fighting game. What I found in this game represents years of game-changing developments in the gaming scene in regards to graphics, combos, and unique characters that invite the player to form their own opinion as to who these masked marauders really are. The player is met with a catchy song upon starting the game, which really shows the amount of thought and hard work the developers put into every detail of this game. At first, I was distraught when trying to figure out the controls. However, after taking the time to smash my hands on every key on the keyboard to fathom these controls, I am proud to say I have ascended to a god-tier status in raw skill and talent. I can see this game entering the esports scene due to the skill required to play, and becoming a multi-billion dollar franchise in the process. To see if any computer can even begin to display the full potential of the lifelike graphics in this game, I took advantage of IBM's Sequoia supercomputer. When attempting to display the graphics at the highest settings, the computer went up in flames. This game encourages one to express themselves through their extravagent, yet simple attire. 34895117.review:
This is quite possibly the funniest game ever created. I am Dead. Fucking. Serious.

At the risk of lauding faint praise on a game that was clearly made as a joke, Brief Karate Foolish is actually really friggin' fun and quite honestly it's almost TOO good. I'm not going to say this game is a 10/10 job because it isn't. But for a title that clearly was deliberatly trying to be a novelty rather than an actual game, BKF is actually a pretty solid fighter. I've played worse tournament fighters that were actually commercially released and you can get this thing for FREE. The controls are simple and smooth, the characters are balanced, and the gameplay has that "easy to learn, tough to master" thing going on that I love so very very much.

That's not to say it's perfect. Depending on the controller you're using, there might be issues. For example, I played with an X-Box 360 USB controller and kept accidentally hitting L3 (the control stick's built in button) which automatically opens the options menu. And there's no way to configure the controller, so if that irks you, you may be better off mapping out a JoyToKey setup. On top of that, the Arcade mode does have a bit of a sharp difficulty spike midway through, especially against certain characters (I'm looking at you, Stretch). Overall though, for a free fighting game, it's worth a play.

And yeah, it's a game about a bunch of nerds fighting each other in their underwear. THAT'S THE JOKE. The developers knew damn well what kind of game they were making and it works as a humorous, if a bit lowbrow parody of other fighting games. If that squicks you out, well, I'm sorry. You're missing out. But if you can look past that or hell, even EMBRACE it, there's a lot of fun to be had. Definitely recommended.

33112737.review:
Wow! Really awesome game! Finally going through those queues paid off! Shame the developers don't seem to have enough confidence in this product to actually be selling it. With a bit of viral marketing, this game should be able to enjoy some sales because of today's meme-oriented nerd market.

Beyond that, however,  we truly have a gem in gameplay and design easily compared to and even outshining what a lot of other developers offer. It's a 3 button fighter (which, by the way, automatically detected my gamepad). The cast might seem limited however, they each play very differently with unique specials moves. Those specials can each be activated with the light, medium or heavy attack with varying range, damage, and hitstun (and recovery) thus, making it quite an intellectual exercise. This game is easily as competitive as games like King or Fighters or Tekken. You really have to time some attacks to be able to juggle enemies and specials can be cancelled into supers. Supers can also be interupted with well-placed or timed attacks. I don't know if it was a regular throw or a command throw but, C. Gomodare kept grabbing me out of my supers with his I-don't-know-if-he's-sucking-my-blood-or-my-nipples throw. However, I don't think the characters are actually balanced enough. 

As I progressed in the arcade mode, I thought I encountered the boss but it was just T. Hikari who has a very punishing moveset comprising specials that act as good mid-range zoning moves. Even though I really liked him, I had to drop my husbando Garigari-kun because he seemed to lack some options. And boy, oh boy, S. Tamade seems so much better with his long ranging pokes and his ability to seemingly combo any moves together. My other favourite is Stretch with his very creative design and animations. Also, his squats specials are op af. His thrusting hips seem to hit everywhere! In front of him, behind and even act as good anti-air. I'm also a big fan of his low-hitting push-ups super. I'm not beyond activating it after winning a match on my fallen opponent as a derogatory and savage display of power as it simulates the act of thrusting oneself wildly in an act of dominating coitus.

Like classic fighting games, BKF doesn't include a babby practice mode or dress-down-your-hoe costumes. BKF seemingly goes back in time in fighting game history since it doesn't even provide different colours for the fighters in mirror matches. Those are actually very fun in this game (as your trying to spot which fighter is yours) compared to watching 2 Karins or Rashids fight in SFV. Also, this game takes inspiration from the award-selling souls series since players don't have the ability to pause gameplay nor is it possible to continue after losing a match in the arcade mode (you have to start over).

You might be resistant to the graphics of the game but all-in-all this is very compelling package with great sound design and music that might stay in your head with its catchiness. I especially like the retro-sounding, smooth but epic character select theme. Also, all the characters seem to have specific post-fight commentary for each other which helps provide context and background for this game's universe and cast's history while deepening their own characterization.

Very recomended plus, it shouldn't affect your sexual orientation (if you care about that (it has already changed (or never was what you thought it were))).

I completely forgot one problem: alt-tab freezes the screen so I have to alt-F4 and always refrain from alt-tabbing which IS an annoyance but, no game is perfect.

8. Мой комментарий (игра с диске) Гонка, а точнее шутер (головоломка) очень страшная, я бы поставил возрастное ограничение classic, я бы даже сказал pleasantly.

Uf...Bueno...Que decir de este juego...
Vamos por lo basico: El juego como se puede ver en las fotos es de pelea, normalmente situada en la calle (O eso aparente la imagen de Google maps que tiene de fondo), y la verdad que seria todo muy normal, si no se tratara de "Chinos" semi desnudos con serios problemas de personalidad...
Nos encontramos antes un juego que facilmente puede ser la competencia en los juegos de pelea del año 2017, y si no lo es por su estetica y graficos avanzados de ultima generacion, es por la diferencia que hay entre cada uno de sus personajes jugables.
Este juego tiene pocos, pere divertidos personajes.
Cada uno tiene algo que los diferencia a todos por ejemplo: Un libro, gafas y una postura de combate que se asemeja a la del jorobado de notredan, pero peor. Un chino panzon con una mascara en la cabeza imitando a rey misterio que bloquea ataques  con la panza y el culo. Uno que tiene graves problemas con la zoodofilia y usa oregas de gato, largando maullidos y que se saca bombas con caras del culo 
Pero, si bien, viendo todo esto por separado parece una completa locura, pero todo junto  (No se como)  queda bien..decemente bien por lo menos....
El juego esta bien para jugar un rato, si encontras a alguien que tenga mas de 10 horas jugadas a este juego tiene graves problemas, pero para jugar unos minutitos y reir esta..bastante bien
Eso si, si te lo descargas, baja el volumen de antemano porque esta bastante alto

Che dire... aprendo il gioco per la prima volta non si può che essere sorpresi dalla grafica, ma un attimo dopo ci si accorge che non ti puoi muovere nel menu con i soliti tasto. Da quel momento ho capito di essere di fronte a un gioco speciale, uno di quei giochi che non dimentichi facilmente. Super Katane Foolish è uno stupro per gli occhi e una goduria per l'anima. Mega Kagnano Frullish è un gioco che non si fa prendere sul serio, e si prende in giro da solo, con i fantastici personaggi cinesi in crisi di mezza età in mutande. Mistic Judo Fantish è un gioco che per i suo costo nullo e i suoi pochi megabyte di memoria occupati è da provare.
Ma torniamo alla mia prima apertura del gioco. Cercavo in tutti i modi di muovere la selezione del menu, e l'ho trovata nei tasti YGHJ e N, ulima la quale fa la stessa cosa dell'H, ma rimaneva ancora una cosa importante, il tasto di selezione. Prima di trovare quest'ultimo ho provato quindi a collegare il gamepad...CRASH. "Va beh, dai riproviamo". CRASH. Arrivato a questo punto premo, continuando a rendere omaggio ai santi paragonandoli a figure di fauna da allevamento, ho trovato un altro modo di muoversi, con le freccette dei numeri del tasto numerico, e infine, sotto al tasto del "Mannaggia" e di fianco a quello del "a Cristo" ho trovato il fatidici tasto selezione, il CANC, che poi, insieme a Fine e a pag[giù] sarà il tasto per tirare mado... tirare cazzotti, calci e colpi energetici dal ca... ma... veramente... un' adochen che parte da pene?
No scusate ma perché state ancora leggendo sta recensione, GIOCATELO ORA per PENEtrare gli avversari con le tue combo fatte a cazz' of dog.
Comunque è un giochino stupido che regala 1-2 orette di gioia giocando da soli e con amici.
Bye

28322905.review:
This game's got special moves, EX moves, supers, throws, dashes/rolls, air blocking, air combos.. it's got it all, and it's free.

The game is made for controllers, but if you're adamant about using keyboard like I am, a big negative thing about the game is the fact that you can't change keybinds. It's a problem when you're used to doing special movements with your left hand, because movement in this game is set to the letters Y,G,H,J instead of W,A,S,D, and the attack buttons are A,Z,X,C (Special, Light, Medium, Heavy).

So if you ARE having this problem, i recommend you try crossing your hands and playing the game like Seth Killian. It's what i did and it made the game 10x more enjoyable...

I want to leave this review with the only combo you'll ever need to know with S. Tamade (Ash Ketchum):
Light (standing or crouching), Medium (st. or cr.), cr. Heavy (makes them airborn), jump, air Light, air Medium, air Heavy, land and do whatever special move you want (normal, EX, or even your super).
Have fun!

This was an unforgettable experience. A flawless fighting game in every way. Every character, combo, move and stage are all perfect. How this isn't game of the year yet is beyond me.

 On top of all this we have some of the most generous developers out there. This game is completely, 100% free. Every single piece of the experience is there without having to pay a penny. It's just a breath of fresh air to see devs who care about the consumer.

 This game is the pinnacle of human ingenuity. This game will definitely stand the test of time for many, many years. Maybe it'll stand up 100s years from now. Who knows? The only game that I could see beating this game in quality is a possible sequel. But the human race isn't ready for that yet. 

 But for now we'll have to settle for this flawless experience that will be loved for many more generations. This game is just a masterpiece in every sense of the word.

With that said, Brief Karate Foolish gets an 11/10. Get it ASAP.

[h1]Otaku or Gay
宅或基[/h1]

名字带有一股“夜露死苦”的暴走族风格，胖次是羞耻度爆表的半裸五花肉的最后防线，颜艺如同猫娘一样萌软或者少女一样娇俏——志在争夺“黑色短裤”(Black Briefs)的空手道锦标赛选手们，即将献上华丽的格斗表演！[spoiler]搜了一下Black Briefs，找到一部男同电影…[/spoiler]

[i]Brief Karate Foolish[/i]是从青睐之光选出来的，我关注了挺久，得知游戏免费上架时还吃了一小鲸。

应该说，游戏在创意方面还是不错的，格斗人物是真人，而且还有各种不忍直视的姿势和表情，必杀技也很死宅（我用武忍贺死丸胡乱搓出了一个大招“恋爱未满”）。可惜实际的BGM没有商店视频的那一首那么洗脑和魔性。

除了制作者自己说的win8和win10可能有运行问题、以及没有全屏和画面调节选项之外，游戏的最大毛病在于改不了键位，而且默认键位是YHGJ对应上下左右，这真是够奇葩的，我按了好一会儿才搞懂。

突然反思了一下，为什么当初会被这个裸宅卖蠢的游戏吸引呢？

[h1]可能是银魂看多了吧…猩猩的裸奔，小将的前**刹车，唉，不提了，伤逝[/h1]

26674882.review:
[h1] 《愚蠢短暂的空手道》	[/h1]（个人翻译，机翻的意思太奇怪了）
这是一个2D格斗游戏，类似和街头、拳王那样的相似打法。
怪蜀黍们身着纸尿布，身怀各种绝技的他们，开始了一场充满基情♂的较量。
游戏方法：方向操作是反过来的，U是↑、J和N是↓、H是←、K是→;Z是轻拳、X是重拳、C是脚击、A是闪避（方向+A）；不同的角色都有不同的招式，具体可以试试看（普招→普通技→普通技方向x2=大招）[spoiler] 大招应该是这样放出来的，反正我按了好久的方向才放出来的= =（前提是PP条要足够才能释放，就是在人物下方的那些小蜡烛，攒够了会集一条PP条）	[/spoiler]
游戏设置：可以调整战斗时的速度（show为最慢战斗速度），可以设置手柄操控（目前没试过）
游戏目标：尽量打倒各种包着纸尿布的怪蜀黍，成为最强的纸尿布蜀黍♂（误）
以下是评鉴内容：
可玩性：4.5/5（打击感堪比小游戏的格斗游戏）
画面感：3/5（人物和背景都是马赛克哎）
流畅度：5/5（一般低配机玩不会卡顿）
音乐：4/5（毕竟是格斗游戏，音乐还行，日系格斗音乐风）

最后，我想说的是，请作者在选项里添加窗口化的设置，不然在游戏途中会一直闪烁窗口和输入法的光标，比较影响游戏体验。
Please post in the option of adding window Settings,.Otherwise the game would have been on the way blinking window and input the cursor, affect the game experience.
[spoiler] 那位猫男抛出的炸弹简直亮瞎了我的眼睛，这很炸弹（It's very bomb.）	[/spoiler]

26672453.review:
Great fighting game! It's pretty balanced, it's fun and it's got briefs, what else do you need? The only real complaint I've got is its compatibility. I can't get the Steam overlay to work properly on it and for some reason it keeps minimizing as long as you've got certain programs open, as those will force themselves to get into focus. Mine was Realtek HD Audio Manager, for whatever reason.

The gameplay style feels surprisingly defensive - Chipping barely does any visible damage, you can block in the air, dodge any attack or even grapple someone out of a dodge.

Regardless, definitely material for EVO! If you're waiting for Tekken 7, this is the game for you, especially since it's free!

26672297.review:
More fun than SFV and better balanced than MVC, an obvious gem most people are missing out on.
Each character feels unique from each other, and the music is pretty good.
It has arcade mode, with its only downside being the ending is a little lackluster.
its also a far more offensive game than Street fighter is, with anti airs leading into juggles and supers, a dodge roll that can be grabbed out of, and very few projectiles. There is also air guarding, and air recoveries allow a retaliation or said guard on use.

biggest complaints are lack of online(its from 2003)  its bugginess with newer OS's and lack of resolution options, but that can be circumvented somewhat with 16 bit colored mode with the window exe.

Definitely EVO material, this one.
